docs.lead_paragraph: Dangerously high levels have been detected in Northeastern songbirds as the most toxic form of the heavy metal moves through the food chain.

headline.seo: Study Finds Mercury in More Northeastern Bird Species
headline.main: Mercury’s Harmful Reach Has Grown, Study Suggests
headline.print_headline: Mercury’s Harmful Reach Has Grown, Study Suggests

docs.abstract: Study conducted by the Biodiversity Research Institute finds that songbirds and bats suffer some of the same types of neurological disorders from mercury poisoning as humans; broad array of wildlife has been harmed by mercury emissions from power plants.
docs.snippet: Dangerously high levels have been detected in Northeastern songbirds as the most toxic form of the heavy metal moves through the food chain.

docs.lead_paragraph: A large rise in the rate of twin births is seen as a result of the growing use of fertility drugs and more births to older women.

headline.main: Twin Births in the U.S., Like Never Before
headline.print_headline: Twin Births in the U.S., Like Never Before

docs.abstract: National Center for Health Statistics reports that the rate of twin births in the United States rose 76 percent from 1980 to 2009, growth that is largely attributable to the increased use of fertility drugs and assisted reproductive technology.
docs.snippet: A large rise in the rate of twin births is seen as a result of the growing use of fertility drugs and more births to older women.

docs.lead_paragraph: The world’s abortion rate, which began declining steadily in the 1990s, has stopped falling, according to a new study.

headline.main: Abortion: Worldwide Rate Stopped Falling After 2003
headline.print_headline: Abortion: Worldwide Rate Stopped Falling After 2003; Researchers Cite Scarcity of Contraception

docs.abstract: Study by Gilda Sedgh, funded by the World Health Organization and published in journal The Lancet finds the world's abortion rate, which began declining steadily in the 1990s, has stopped falling; researchers attribute change to a decline in access to birth control.
docs.snippet: The world’s abortion rate, which began declining steadily in the 1990s, has stopped falling, according to a new study.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal expansion of a crime definition draws attention to victims in “a cultural blind spot.”

headline.seo: As Victims, Men Struggle for Rape Awareness

docs.abstract: Rape is widely thought of as a crime against women, but in a recent national survey, 1.4 percent of men said that they had been raped at some point, and studies have shown that as many as one in six men experienced unwanted sexual contact as minors; the federal government recently expanded its definition of rape to include a wider range of sexual assaults, including those against men, which will now be included in national crime statistics on rape.
docs.snippet: A federal expansion of a crime definition draws attention to victims in “a cultural blind spot.”

docs.lead_paragraph: A study suggests a possible association between listening to music through headphones and being hit by a vehicle.

headline.seo: Accident Risk Seen for Pedestrians Wearing Headphones
headline.main: Hazards: Pedestrians Are Advised to Keep Ears Open
headline.print_headline: Hazards: Pedestrians Are Advised to Keep Ears Open

docs.abstract: Study by Richard Lichenstein published in journal Injury Prevention finds walking around while listening to an iPod or an MP3 player through earphones may increase the dangers of being injured by a vehicle; more than half the accidents studied involved trains.
docs.snippet: A study suggests a possible association between listening to music through headphones and being hit by a vehicle.

docs.lead_paragraph: British researchers found that a common American practice for in vitro fertilization was associated with more complications than the transfer of just two embryos.

headline.seo: Use of 3 or More In Vitro Embryos Is Too Risky, Study Concludes
headline.main: Regimens: Use of 3 or More Embryos Is Called Too Risky
headline.print_headline: Regimens: Use of 3 or More Embryos Is Called Too Risky

docs.abstract: British study published in journal The Lancet finds that the transfer of more than two embryos during in vitro fertilization does not increase the number of live births, but it does increase the risk of complications; about 40 percent of in vitro fertilizations in the United States currently involve the transfer of three or more embryos.
docs.snippet: British researchers found that a common American practice for in vitro fertilization was associated with more complications than the transfer of just two embryos.

docs.lead_paragraph: No matter how researchers looked at data, they could not uncover a correlation between childhood obesity and the sale of sweets and salty snacks in public schools.

headline.seo: Study Finds No Childhood Obesity Link to School Junk Food
headline.main: Nutrition: No Obesity Link to Junk Food in Schools
headline.print_headline: Nutrition: No Obesity Link to Junk Food in Schools

docs.abstract: Study by Jennifer Van Hook published in journal Sociology of Education finds no correlation at all between obesity and attending a school where sweets and salty snacks are available, suggesting that efforts to ban the sale of junk food in schools may not be effective.
docs.snippet: No matter how researchers looked at data, they could not uncover a correlation between childhood obesity and the sale of sweets and salty snacks in public schools.

docs.lead_paragraph: What disgusts humans is proving irresistible to researchers exploring the evolutionary value of revulsion.

headline.seo: Disgust’s Evolutionary Role Is Irresistible to Researchers

docs.abstract: Human emotion of disgust, an emotion long neglected by psychologists, has become the subject of a flurry of new books and papers by scientists; evolutionary psychologists are now looking at disgust as an important and complicated adaptation to avoid disease-causing microbes and parasites that involves not only taste and smell but also sight and touch.
docs.snippet: What disgusts humans is proving irresistible to researchers exploring the evolutionary value of revulsion.

docs.lead_paragraph: Light and simple, enjoyable but not distracting, these portable meals will keep you going through the workday.

headline.seo: Tuna, Chickpeas and Broccoli Salad With Yogurt Dressing

docs.snippet: Light and simple, enjoyable but not distracting, these portable meals will keep you going through the workday.
